text: After careful research online, me and my fiancee decided to select Vineyard as our ROM lunch reception venue. We select the outdoor patio as the ROM ceremony and the indoor air conditioned restaurant for the lunch reception. Have to say the actual event turned out super great. Best choice ever. And the key factor to make this event so successful is our coordinator Mr Aaron Gardner, the senior partnership exec from Vineyard. He is the one that guide us thru from start to end and ensure all the requests (so long is reasonable) being met and able to give tonnes of useful advices based on our condition. So so grateful to have him to be our key planner on our big day!!! Highly recommended to look for Mr Aaron and select Vineyard for any of your important events:)

My husband brought me to celebrate my birthday at Vineyard last week, and it was an absolutely wonderful experience. From the moment we arrived, we were impressed by the warm, romantic ambiance—spacious, tranquil, and beautifully inviting.

The food was exceptional, with every dish exceeding our expectations. The serene atmosphere made our evening even more special, allowing us to enjoy a quiet, intimate dinner together.

Overall, Vineyard is the perfect place for a romantic celebration. We highly recommend it to couples looking for a memorable dining experience.

Hidden gem tranquil place. Had duck fritter, burrata w prosciutto, Delicious oven roasted poulet and red snapper, dark chocolate dessert was moist with biscoff crumbs and ice cream. Super yummy and will be back again ☺️
Nice atmosphere and setting. Food flavours for all 10 of our dishes were amazing. Pricing is very reasonable for the quality. Service was friendly and helpful.

Enjoyed my evening at Hortpark! Food was great - compliments to the newly appointed head chef Gumsan! Our attendant Kabilan was great, kept the atmosphere light and was very keen to make recommendations. Desserts were excellent too! Enjoyed the ambience. Not too crowded, not too loud. Overall a very pleasant experience.
